plugins.name: Fixiq ‚Äî Fix the scale of working area
plugins.description:
Intro

In Figma, the current scale is not shown anywhere on the canvas. You can‚Äôt see how far you have moved from the actual scale of the frame. You can only select the frame and see its dimensions. And then estimate the ratio of pixels to percentages.


In Figma, you can zoom in to 100% once using hotkeys. But any movement on the board can lead to an accidental change in scale.


Solution

Fixiq not only fixes the 100% scale, but can also change it to 50%, 100%, 200%.


Plugin will be useful not only for designers, but also for managers. With Fixiq you can easily design interfaces of non-standard sizes/proportions and be sure about the scale you're working with. Your layouts will always be in the actual/original size. Managers can present project results to clients without irritating zooming.

accepted.name: Roman Nebel
accepted.description: IT Manager / UX Expert / Pet-projects Developer

plugins.tagline: Figma plugin that fixes the scale of working area

plugins.description:

‚Ä¢ Professional color coding (green start, red end, yellow decisions)

‚Ä¢ Shape-specific text wrapping for clean diagrams

‚Ä¢ Support for rectangles [text], diamonds {text}, and ellipses (text)

‚Ä¢ No external dependencies - works entirely within FigJam


Perfect for business process documentation, software workflows, and technical diagrams. Simply paste your Mermaid code and generate publication-ready flowcharts instantly.

137859.release_notes:
## [2.7.1] - 2025-06-15

### üêõ Critical Bug Fixes
- **Fixed standalone node parsing**: Now correctly parses both standalone node definitions and edge connections
  - **Issue**: Nodes were displaying IDs (Q, C, T) instead of text labels ("Pick a drink", "Coffee", "Tea")
  - **Root cause**: Parser only processed edge connections, ignored standalone node definitions
  - **Solution**: Enhanced parser to handle both `Q{Pick a drink}` definitions AND `Q --> C` connections
- **Complete syntax support**: All node types now correctly display text labels
  - `[Rectangle text]` ‚úÖ
  - `{Diamond text}` ‚úÖ 
  - `(Ellipse text)` ‚úÖ
  - `([Ellipse text])` ‚úÖ (both ellipse syntaxes supported)

### üîß Code Quality Improvements
- **Removed dead code**: Eliminated unused `_calculateLegacyLayout()` function (39 lines removed)
- **Optimized function signatures**: Removed unused `levels` parameter from `resolveNodeCollisions()`
- **Consolidated configuration**: Created unified `SHAPE_CONFIG` object for all node types
  - **Before**: Scattered across `getShapeTextConfig()`, `getNodeColors()`, `getShapeType()`
  - **After**: Single source of truth with `SHAPE_CONFIG` and `ROLE_COLORS` objects
- **Enhanced documentation**: Added comprehensive JSDoc comments for all public functions
- **Improved linting**: Created `.eslintignore` to exclude generated `code.js` file

### üß™ Testing & Validation
- **Extensive test coverage**: Verified with 5 diverse Mermaid test cases
  - Mixed node types with edge labels ‚úÖ
  - Left-right layouts with long text ‚úÖ
  - Complex branching decision trees ‚úÖ
  - Simple linear processes ‚úÖ
  - Multiple start/end points ‚úÖ
- **Version logging**: Added console logging to verify latest code is running
- **Clean builds**: All code compiles without errors and passes linting

### üìä Benefits
- ‚úÖ **Correct text display** - All node text labels now show properly instead of IDs
- ‚úÖ **Complete Mermaid support** - Both standalone definitions and edge syntax work perfectly
- ‚úÖ **Maintainable codebase** - Cleaner code with consolidated configuration and documentation
- ‚úÖ **Production ready** - Robust parsing handles real-world Mermaid syntax patterns
- ‚úÖ **Developer experience** - JSDoc documentation and clean code structure
137859.tagline: Convert Mermaid markup to FigJam flowcharts

plugins.name: Padding Check
plugins.description: Are developers always at your back since your paddings are always not multiples of 4? This plugin solves this problem of yours where you can quickly identify the Figma frames with the said padding issues. The plugin has a very simple UI where we have info display section and 2 buttons. 1st button "Highlight frames" selects all problematic frames and brings them to your view (Shift+1) and the 2nd button "Mark frames" creates a red box around all the frames that have a padding issue. The good news is that this plugin works only for Auto layout frames and not for all frames thereby not giving you unwanted results. As a helper once the plugin is executed (either of the buttons used to find the frames with issues) The information section of the plugin UI displays the count of the frames with issues helping the user to quickly take account of the issue.
plugins.tagline: Are all paddings in your Figma file multiples of 4? Use this plugin to quickly identify if not!

plugins.name: Varcator - Figma Variable Usage Finder
plugins.description:
Varcator - Figma Variable Usage Finder For Dev Mode


Varcator is a Figma plugin that helps you find where text variables are being used in your design files. It provides an efficient way to scan and track variable usage across your Figma projects.


üî• Highly Recommend to select one variable at a time. üî•


Features


  1. Variable Collection Scanning: Scan all text variables in your Figma file
  2. Selective Scanning: Choose which variables to scan for usage
  3. Usage Tracking: Find where each variable is being used
  4. Interactive UI: Click on usages to navigate to the specific layers
  5. Efficient Processing: Optimized scanning with rate limiting to prevent API throttling
  6. User-Friendly Interface: Clean and intuitive design for easy variable management

plugins.name: Fillio - Elevate design with dynamic content
plugins.description:
Fillio - Less Typing, More Designing


Fillio is the simplest way to populate your Figma designs with realistic {{placeholder}} content. Whether you‚Äôre working on wireframes, prototypes, invoices, brand books, or daily UI design, Fillio saves you time by instantly filling your artboards with dynamic content.



Key Features:


Quick & Easy Filling:

Fill your designs with placeholders like names, addresses, and all type of contents in a single click.


Customizable Placeholders:

Use simple tags like {{name}} or {{Date}} to create dynamic content that fits your design.


Efficient Workflow:

Skip the tedious task of manually adding content‚Äîlet Fillio do the heavy lifting.


Perfect for Prototypes & Wireframes:

Make your designs look polished even in early stages, without all the manual effort.



How it Works:


  1. Install Fillio from the Figma Community.
  2. Select the elements or frames where you want to add placeholders.
  3. Define Your Placeholders using simple tags like {{name}} or {{Type}}.
  4. Click ‚ÄúSubmit‚Äù, and Fillio automatically adds content to your design.



Get Started with Fillio Today!

accepted.name: Mohammed M.Akasha
accepted.description: A User-centered Designer who crafts meaningful products through design.

Introduction

Image Size Integration allows Figma users to efficiently manage and integrate images within frames, groups, and components. With this plugin, you can adjust image sizes and apply uniform dimensions for a consistent design output.


Function Description

  1. Allows users to select multiple elements (Frames, Groups, Components, Text, Instances, etc.) in a Figma design.
  2. Automatically calculates the maximum width and height from the selected elements.
  3. Displays each selected image inside a preview box, either maintaining its original size or resizing it based on the longest side, as determined by the user's settings.
  4. A toggle feature to switch between maintaining the image's original size or scaling it to fit the preview box.
  5. Supports flexible control over how images are displayed within their allocated preview space.


How to Use

  1. Select the elements (Frames, Groups, Text, Components, Instances, etc.) you want to preview and adjust.
  2. Click the "Generate Base64 Preview" button to create image previews.
  3. Use the toggle to switch between keeping the image‚Äôs original size or scaling it to fit the preview box.
  4. View the adjusted images and their corresponding dimensions directly within the plugin's interface.


Notes

  1. The plugin supports both raster images and vector elements.
  2. Images will be displayed in a fixed-size preview box, and resizing settings apply based on your toggle choice.
  3. The plugin works with selected elements in Figma's canvas, so ensure you have the right items selected before applying the tool.

plugins.name: BableBox
plugins.description:
BableBox is a Figma plugin designed to make translating your interfaces a breeze. With a single click, it converts your entire design from one language to another, preserving context to ensure accurate, natural translations.


Say goodbye to the hassle of translating hundreds of words and phrases manually! BableBox leverages GPT-4o mini, one of the best AI models, which understands the context of each text to avoid errors (it intelligently skips icons and symbols like FontAwesome, for instance).


This plugin is perfect for designers and global teams looking for a fast, reliable, and easy solution to translate projects while maintaining content coherence and quality.


In short: a one-click translation tool built to save you time and reduce errors. üåçüöÄ
plugins.tagline: BableBox: Translate your designs in one click, with perfect context üåç

plugins.name: Juxync
plugins.description:
Want to get alpha access to Jux? Visit jux.io


Jux is a code-based canvas design tool that plugs right into developer's codebase, enabling product designers to design the UI itself and developers its logic.

Creating a good color tokens system is a complex task. Use Juxync to import your variables to Jux to use as design tokens. Juxync will convert your variables collections, groups and modes into token sets to use in Jux. It will maintain all the relationships between variables.


How does Juxync work?

For more visual ‚Äòhow does it work‚Äò, visit the knowledge base

  1. It scans Figma color variables in your chosen file.
  2. The plugin auto maps the tokens into core, and other semantics sets.
  3. Sync the tokens into the Jux token management, allowing developers to view and use these tokens via our CLI.


Next up: (or Future features)

  1. Sync Assets (SVG)
  2. Dimensions tokens
  3. Typography styles
  4. Check out the roadmap for more information


Want to be among the first to join the alpha? Join our community

plugins.name: Mendly ‚Äî Merge & Fix Broken Variables
plugins.description:
**Streamline your design system maintenance with powerful variable management tools.**


## Key Features


**üîÑ Smart Variable Merging**

- Combine duplicate color variables into one

- Automatically updates all references throughout your design

- Preserves semantic variable relationships

- Optional renaming during merge process


**üîß Broken Variable Detection & Repair**

- Scans current page for broken variable references

- Smart suggestions based on variable naming patterns

- Navigate between elements using the same broken variable

- Batch fix multiple variables at once


**‚ö° Intelligent Analysis**

- Shows direct vs semantic variable usage

- Counts affected elements before merging

- Identifies variable dependencies

- Context-aware replacement suggestions


**üéØ Perfect For**

- Design system cleanup and maintenance

- Removing duplicate variables after design updates

- Fixing broken references after variable deletions

- Streamlining color variable organization


**üí° How It Works**

1. Select source variable (will be removed) and target variable (will remain)

2. Preview affected elements and usage statistics

3. Merge variables with one click - all references automatically update

4. Use the fix tool to repair any broken variable links


Save hours of manual work and keep your design system clean and organized!
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly merge duplicate variables and fix broken references in your design system.

plugins.name: Structura ‚Äì Effortless Page Organization
plugins.description:
Effortlessly organize and standardize your Figma files with reusable page templates.


Structura helps teams and designers maintain consistency across projects by enabling the creation, saving, and application of structured page layouts. Whether you prefer using built-in presets or custom templates, Structura simplifies your workflow, ensuring every file is clear and organized.



‚ú® Key Features


  1. Create & Save Custom Templates ‚Äì Design your own page structures and reuse them effortlessly.
  2. Use Ready-Made Presets ‚Äì Get started instantly with professionally designed page layouts.
  3. One-Click Template Application ‚Äì Quickly apply a structure to any Figma file.
  4. Consistent File Organization ‚Äì Standardize file layouts for better team collaboration.
  5. Easy Editing & Updating ‚Äì Modify and update templates as your workflow evolves.



üöÄ How to Use


  1. Choose a Template ‚Äì Select from built-in presets or create your own.
  2. Apply to Your File ‚Äì Instantly structure your Figma pages with one click.
  3. Customize as Needed ‚Äì Edit sections or save new layouts for future use.
  4. Stay Organized ‚Äì Ensure every file follows a consistent and streamlined structure.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly organize and standardize your Figma files with reusable page templates.

plugins.name: Zuuvi Export Service
plugins.description:
Zuuvi Export Service is a Figma plugin designed to integrate Figma with Zuuvi‚Äôs Studio platform, making it easier and more efficient for designers who work with both tools. The plugin helps reduce the need to manually recreate designs in Studio after first mocking them up in Figma. While built around Figma‚Äôs capabilities, the exported result aims to reflect the original design as closely as possible within the constraints of Studio‚Äôs features.


Easily export ad creatives from Figma directly into your Zuuvi workspace - ready for production, personalisation, and cross-channel publishing.

Whether you're designing HTML5 banners, social media ads, retail media formats or in-store screens, this plugin helps creative teams move faster and stay in control.


üîß What You Can Do with the Zuuvi Plugin:

  1. Export static or layered ad designs directly from Figma to Zuuvi
  2. Optimise for use across display, social, retail media, DOOH, video, and more
  3. Support for production-ready HTML5 ad creatives
  4. Maintain template structure and layer control for streamlined animation workflows


üöÄ Why Use Zuuvi for Your Ad Production?

Zuuvi is a Creative Performance Platform that empowers marketers and designers to:


  1. Build high-quality, high-performing HTML5 ads at speed
  2. Personalise and localise creatives across channels and markets
  3. Scale ad production without adding design overhead
  4. Centralise all ad formats - from social media creatives to dynamic banners - in one platform


üìö Documentation & Support

Full plugin guide and step-by-step tutorials: https://help.zuuvi.com/en/articles/10774913-how-to-export-from-figma-to-zuuvi-studio


Questions? Reach out anytime via our live chat or care@zuuvi.com


üß© Requirements

To use this plugin, an active Zuuvi account is required.

Not a user yet? Learn more and book a demo here.


üîí Data Security

We value your creative integrity and your data privacy. Zuuvi follows best practices for security, and all plugin exports are processed securely through your Zuuvi account.


Design in Figma. Scale in Zuuvi.

From idea to high-performing ad campaign ‚Äì Zuuvi makes creative production fast, scalable, and impactful.
plugins.tagline: Convert your Figma designs to omnichannel ad campaigns

plugins.name: Paint swatch
plugins.description:
Enter the name of the paint color you want to swatch, and it'll make a rectangle of your chosen color with with a name that links to the color's page its respective website.


Supported libraries:

  1. Farrow and Ball
  2. Little Greene
  3. Paint & Paper Library
  4. Edward Bulmer
